item.name: MySQL begin operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL bytes received per second
item.description:
The number of bytes received from all clients.
It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL bytes sent per second
item.description:
The number of bytes sent to all clients.
It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL commit operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL delete operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL insert operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL queries per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL rollback operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL select operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL slow queries
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL status
item.description:
It requires user parameter mysql.ping, which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.
0 - MySQL server is down 1 - MySQL server is up

item.name: MySQL update operations per second
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL uptime
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.status[*], which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: MySQL version
item.description: It requires user parameter mysql.version, which is defined in userparameter_mysql.conf.

item.name: Agent ping
item.description: The agent always returns 1 for this item. It could be used in combination with nodata() for availability check.

item.name: Values processed by Zabbix proxy per second
Values processed by Zabbix server per second
comp Accumulated time spent in compilation
comp Name of the current JIT compiler
gc ConcurrentMarkSweep accumulated time spent in collection
gc ConcurrentMarkSweep number of collections per second
gc Copy accumulated time spent in collection
gc Copy number of collections per second
gc MarkSweepCompact accumulated time spent in collection
gc MarkSweepCompact number of collections per second
gc ParNew accumulated time spent in collection
gc ParNew number of collections per second
gc PS MarkSweep accumulated time spent in collection
gc PS MarkSweep number of collections per second
gc PS Scavenge accumulated time spent in collection
gc PS Scavenge number of collections per second
Maximum number of active sessions so far
Number of active sessions at this moment
Number of sessions created by this manager per second
Number of sessions we rejected due to maxActive being reached
The maximum number of active Sessions allowed, or -1 for no limit

item.description: Available memory is defined as free+cached+buffers memory.

item.name: CPU available physical processors in the shared pool
CPU number of physical processors consumed
Host name
item.description: System host name.

item.name: Number of logged in users
item.description: Number of users who are currently logged in.

item.name: Number of processes
item.description: Total number of processes in any state.

item.name: Number of running processes
item.description: Number of processes in running state.

item.name: Pages paged in from paging space
Pages paged out to paging space

item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.name: Processor load (15 min average per core)
item.description: The processor load is calculated as system CPU load divided by number of CPU cores.

item.description: The information as normally returned by 'uname -a'.

item.description: Full counter name: \System\File Read Bytes/sec

discovery_rule.name: Disk partitions
discovery_rule.description:
The rule will discover all disk partitions matching the global regexp "Storage devices for SNMP discovery".
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Allocation units for storage $1
item_prototype.description: The size, in bytes, of the data objects allocated from this pool. If this entry is monitoring sectors, blocks, buffers, or packets, for example, this number will commonly be greater than one. Otherwise this number will typically be one.

item_prototype.name: Description of storage $1
item_prototype.description: A description of the type and instance of the storage described by this entry.

item_prototype.name: Total disk space on $1
item_prototype.description: This is a calculated item, we need it to get total disk space in bytes.

item_prototype.name: Total disk space on $1 in units
item_prototype.description: The size of the storage represented by this entry, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits. This object is writable to allow remote configuration of the size of the storage area in those cases where such an operation makes sense and is possible on the underlying system. For example, the amount of main memory allocated to a buffer pool might be modified or the amount of disk space allocated to virtual memory might be modified.

item_prototype.name: Used disk space on $1
item_prototype.description: This is a calculated item, we need it to get used disk space in bytes.

item_prototype.name: Used disk space on $1 in units
item_prototype.description: The amount of the storage represented by this entry that is allocated, in units of hrStorageAllocationUnits.

trigger_prototype.name: Free disk space is less than 20% on volume {#SNMPVALUE}

item.name: Device contact details
item.description: The textual identification of the contact person for this managed node, together with information on how to contact this person. If no contact information is known, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device description
item.description: A textual description of the entity. This value should include the full name and version identification of the system's hardware type, software operating-system, and networking software.

item.name: Device location
item.description: The physical location of this node (e.g., `telephone closet, 3rd floor'). If the location is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device name
item.description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is the zero-length string.

item.name: Device uptime
item.description: The time since the network management portion of the system was last re-initialized.

item.name: Number of network interfaces
item.description: The number of network interfaces (regardless of their current state) present on this system.

discovery_rule.name: Network interfaces
discovery_rule.description:
You may also consider using IF-MIB::ifType or IF-MIB::ifAlias for discovery depending on your filtering needs.
{$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Admin status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The desired state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Description of interface $1
item_prototype.description: A textual string containing information about the interface. This string should include the name of the manufacturer, the product name and the version of the interface hardware/software.

item_prototype.name: Inbound errors on interface $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol.

item_prototype.name: Incoming traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets in valid MAC frames received on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

item_prototype.name: Operational status of interface $1
item_prototype.description: The current operational state of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Outbound errors on interface $1
item_prototype.description: For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that could not be transmitted because of errors. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that could not be transmitted because of errors.

item_prototype.name: Outgoing traffic on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of octets transmitted in MAC frames on this interface, including the MAC header and FCS.

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status was changed on {HOST.NAME} interface {#SNMPVALUE}

discovery_rule.name: Processors
discovery_rule.description: {$SNMP_COMMUNITY} is a global macro.

item_prototype.name: Utilization of processor #$1
item_prototype.description: The average, over the last minute, of the percentage of time that this processor was not idle. Implementations may approximate this one minute smoothing period if necessary.

discovery_rule.name: Discover VMware clusters
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of clusters

discovery_rule.name: Discover VMware hypervisors
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of hypervisors.

discovery_rule.name: Discover VMware VMs
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of guest virtual machines.

item.name: Ballooned memory
item.description: The amount of guest physical memory that is currently reclaimed through the balloon driver.

item.name: Cluster name
item.description: Cluster name of the guest VM.

item.name: Committed storage space
item.description: Total storage space, in bytes, committed to this virtual machine across all datastores.

item.name: Compressed memory
item.description: The amount of memory currently in the compression cache for this VM.

item.name: CPU usage
item.description: Current upper-bound on CPU usage. The upper-bound is based on the host the virtual machine is current running on, as well as limits configured on the virtual machine itself or any parent resource pool. Valid while the virtual machine is running.

item.name: Guest memory usage
item.description: The amount of guest physical memory that is being used by the VM.

item.name: Host memory usage
item.description: The amount of host physical memory allocated to the VM, accounting for saving from memory sharing with other VMs.

item.name: Hypervisor name
item.description: Hypervisor name of the guest VM.

item.name: Memory size
item.description: Total size of configured memory.

item.name: Number of virtual CPUs
item.description: Number of virtual CPUs assigned to the guest.

item.name: Power state
item.description: The current power state of the virtual machine.

item.name: Private memory
item.description: Amount of memory backed by host memory and not being shared.

item.name: Shared memory
item.description: The amount of guest physical memory shared through transparent page sharing.

item.name: Swapped memory
item.description: The amount of guest physical memory swapped out to the VM's swap device by ESX.

item.name: Uncommitted storage space
item.description: Additional storage space, in bytes, potentially used by this virtual machine on all datastores.

item.name: Unshared storage space
item.description: Total storage space, in bytes, occupied by the virtual machine across all datastores, that is not shared with any other virtual machine.

item.name: Uptime
item.description: System uptime.

discovery_rule.name: Disk device discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of all disk devices.

item_prototype.name: Average number of kilobytes read from the disk $3
Average number of kilobytes written to the disk $3
Average number of reads from the disk $3
Average number of writes to the disk $3

discovery_rule.name: Mounted filesystem discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of all guest file systems.

discovery_rule.name: Network device discovery
discovery_rule.description: Discovery of all network devices.

item_prototype.name: Number of bytes received on interface $3
Number of bytes transmitted on interface $3
Number of packets received on interface $3
Number of packets transmitted on interface $3

item.name: Ballooned memory
item.description: The amount of guest physical memory that is currently reclaimed through the balloon driver. Sum of all guest VMs.

item.name: Bios UUID
item.description: The hardware BIOS identification.

item.name: Cluster name
item.description: Cluster name of the guest VM.

item.name: CPU cores
item.description: Number of physical CPU cores on the host. Physical CPU cores are the processors contained by a CPU package.

item.name: CPU frequency
item.description: The speed of the CPU cores. This is an average value if there are multiple speeds. The product of CPU frequency and number of cores is approximately equal to the sum of the MHz for all the individual cores on the host.

item.name: CPU model
item.description: The CPU model.

item.name: CPU threads
item.description: Number of physical CPU threads on the host.

item.name: CPU usage
item.description: Aggregated CPU usage across all cores on the host in Hz. This is only available if the host is connected.

item.name: Full name
item.description: The complete product name, including the version information.

item.name: Model
item.description: The system model identification.

item.name: Number of guest VMs
item.description: Number of guest virtual machines.

item.name: Overall status
item.description: The overall alarm status of the host: gray - unknown, ok, red - it has a problem, yellow - it might have a problem.

item.name: Total memory
item.description: The physical memory size.

item.name: Uptime
item.description: System uptime.

item.name: Used memory
item.description: Physical memory usage on the host.

item.name: Vendor
item.description: The hardware vendor identification.

item.name: Version
item.description: Dot-separated version string.

item_prototype.name: Average read latency of the datastore $3
Average write latency of the datastore $3

item.name: Free number of inodes on $1 in %
Free number of inodes on $1 in %
Free number of inodes on $1 in %
Free number of inodes on $1 in %
Free number of inodes on $1 in %
Average disk read queue length
item.key: perf_counter[\Physical Disk(_Total)\Avg. Disk Read Queue Length]

item.name: Average Read Transfer Time to Disk C:
Average Read Transfer Time to Disk _Total
Average Write Transfer Time to Disk _Total
Avg. Combined(Read/Write) Transfer Operation to Disk
Memory Commit Limit (RAM plus Page File)

/etc/passwd has been changed on {HOST.NAME}
/etc/passwd has been changed on {HOST.NAME}

70% http-8080 worker threads busy on {HOST.NAME}
70% http-8443 worker threads busy on {HOST.NAME}
70% jk-8009 worker threads busy on {HOST.NAME}
70% mem Heap Memory used on {HOST.NAME}
70% mem Non-Heap Memory used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template JMX Generic:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Old Gen",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template JMX Generic:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Old Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mp CMS Old Gen used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template JMX Generic:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Perm Gen",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template JMX Generic:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=CMS Perm Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mp CMS Perm Gen used on {HOST.NAME}
70% mp Code Cache used on {HOST.NAME}
70% mp Perm Gen used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template JMX Generic:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Old Gen",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template JMX Generic:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Old Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mp PS Old Gen used on {HOST.NAME}

trigger.expression: {Template JMX Generic:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Perm Gen",Usage.used].last(0)}>({Template JMX Generic:jmx["java.lang:type=MemoryPool,name=PS Perm Gen",Usage.max].last(0)}*0.7)
trigger.name: 70% mp PS Perm Gen used on {HOST.NAME}
70% mp Tenured Gen used on {HOST.NAME}

70% os Process CPU Load on {HOST.NAME}
Aggregate Disk Idle Time below 30% for 10 Minutes
Apache is not running on {HOSTNAME}
Apache is not running on {HOSTNAME}
